name: A Letter to Three Wives Online Trivia | L | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which notable director both directed and wrote the screenplay for 'A Letter to Three Wives'?
questions.explanation:
Joseph L. Mankiewicz

	Mankiewicz won two Oscars for his work on this film, one for Best Director and one for Best Writing.  The film was also nominated for Best Picture, but failed to win.

questions.text: 'A Letter to Three Wives' was based on a novel entitled 'A Letter to Five Wives' by which author?
questions.explanation:
John Klempner.

	For time purposes, Mankiewicz cut two of the five wives out of production.  He actually intended to only cut one, and Anne Baxter was to be featured as the fourth wive, but ultimately this section of the film was sacrificed.  Too bad, Anne Baxter would have been great!

questions.text: The villain in 'A Letter to Three Wives' is a woman with the last name Ross who seems to be the most enticing bachelorette in town.  What is her first name?
questions.explanation:
Addie.

	Addie Ross is never seen in the film.  She is the author of the letter that is read towards the beginning of the film in which she claims to have run off with one of the three wives' husbands. In one scene, the Linda Darnell character is looking at a picture of Addie (that the audience can't see).  It turns out that the actual picture is of Otto Preminger, a director with whom Darnell had a difficult time in another film.  Mankiewicz placed Preminger's picture there in order to get the desired emotional effect.

questions.text: Which actress provides the voice for the mysterious Ms. Ross, who never appears in person during the film?
questions.explanation:
Celeste Holm.

	Celeste Holm's lilting voice can be overheard as a quasi-narration for the film.  Apparently, the studio ran a number of 'Who is Addie?' contests across the country to see if audience members could recognize Holm's beautiful voice.

questions.text: Now to the performers.  Contestant #1: She is Deborah Bishop, a girl from the country who has married Brad, a handsome, charming and cosmopolitan fellow who seems to be the most popular man in town.  Which actress plays Deborah in the film?
questions.explanation:
Jeanne Crain.

	Jeanne Crain appeared in classics such as 'State Fair' and 'Margie' before acquiring the part of Deborah in 'A Letter to Three Wives'.  Afterwards, she worked in such films as 'Cheaper by the Dozen', 'Gentlemen Marry Brunettes' and 'The Joker Is Wild'.

questions.text: The second wife is a radio scriptwriter played by Ann Sothern.  What is her full name?
questions.explanation:
Rita Phipps.

	Ann Sothern was a very popular actress from the 30s and 40s.  She appeared in dozens of films, including her series of 'Maisie' films, which lasted from 1939 to 1947.

questions.text: The third of the three wives, Lora Mae, is played by the beautiful Linda Darnell.  Her character, a girl from a poor family who nabs a rich business man, is sassy and unhappy.  This is largely due to her unhappy marriage to whom?
questions.explanation:
Porter Hollingsway.

	The cynical Porter Hollingsway is played marvellously by Paul Douglas.  Linda Darnell is also excellent as Lora Mae Hollingsway.  Porter believes that Lora Mae is a golddigger, while Lora Mae believes that Porter is completely uncommitted.

questions.text: Which actor with an unmistakable dimple on his chin plays George, a school teacher and husband to the Ann Sothern character?
questions.explanation:
Kirk Douglas.

	There seems to be some tension between George and Rita in the film, largely due to the fact that Rita is the main breadwinner in the family.  However, this seems to affect Rita more than George, who takes it in stride.  Douglas is charming as George in this film, especially when he rants about the insipid nature of radio programming.

questions.text: Which actress makes an uncredited appearance as Sadie Dugan, a housekeeper for one of the families in the film?
questions.explanation:
Thelma Ritter.

	This was only six-time Academy Award nominee Thelma Ritter's second big screen appearance, her first also uncredited in 'Miracle on 34th Street'.  Even in her relatively small role in this film, it's obvious that Ritter will become a big star.

questions.text: Where have the the three wives been off to all day, making it impossible to learn with which of their husbands Ms. Ross has left until the end of the film?
questions.explanation:
Children's picnic.

	The three women are all conveniently out of town when Addie Ross makes her move.  This allows them the time to daydream about their topsy-turvy relationships with their husbands. Thank you for playing this quiz, I hope you have enjoyed it.
